citations.narrative:
The fence that serves as a public barrier around the Tiger enclosure is damaged by fallen tree limbs. Inside the Tiger
enclosure there is a dead tree which could potentially fall and impact the primary enclosure fence. This could potentially
allow the Tiger to escape. The dead tree should be removed, and all other trees must be maintained to prevent damage
to the fencing. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair
to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
Corrected at time of the inspection.

In the drive through area of the park the perimeter fence near the giraffe enclosure is incomplete and has a wide opening.
The fence must be constructed so that it protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized
persons from going through it or under it and having contact with the animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a
secondary containment system for the animals in the facility.
Corrected at time of the inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The fence that serves as a public barrier around the Tiger enclosure is damaged by fallen tree limbs. Inside the Tiger 
enclosure there is a dead tree which could potentially fall and impact the primary enclosure fence. This could potentially 
allow the Tiger to escape. The dead tree should be removed, and all other trees must be maintained to prevent damage 
to the fencing. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair 
to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.  
 
Corrected at time of the inspection. 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
In the drive through area of the park the perimeter fence near the giraffe enclosure is incomplete and has a wide opening. 
The fence must be constructed so that it protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized 
persons from going through it or under it and having contact with the animals in the facility, and so that it can function as a 
secondary containment system for the animals in the facility.  
 
Corrected at time of the inspection. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
